intro: Hieracium macroglossum, commonly known as the large-tongued hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive, tongue-like structure, and it produces achenes as its seed type. Hieracium macroglossum is often found in open habitats and can be an indicator of nutrient-rich soils.
